title: (x) Slab Serif Font ID - Nilland {R}
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20110928080912im_/http:/typophile.com/files/slab_serif_identification_5182.jpg)

I'm trying to identify a font with a slab serif.

I've looked at ITC Lubalin Graph, Rockwell, Karnak Pro and Museo. I thought I was very close with Museo but the uppercase A has a serif at the top that points to the right and the lowercase "a" is shaped differently. I also checked the alternate characters on these fonts and there are not characters that match this font.

Any thoughts on what the name of this font is?

Thank you,
author: B Bohnhoff

comments.content: This is a free one by Manfred Klein, called [Nilland](http://web.archive.org/web/20110928080912/http:/www.dafont.com/nilland.font). You’re not the first to search for it — have a look at the comments in the older [thread](http://web.archive.org/web/20110928080912/http:/www.typophile.com/node/64934).
Thank you. That helps considerably. Much appreciated.
